docna.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Second Flood Rehabilitation
            Project : Credit 1876 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Bangladesh - Second Flood
            Rehabilitation Project : Credit 1876 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
In an attempt to provide assistance for
            flood rehabilitation, the project aims to rehabilitate or
            replace priority elements of flood-damaged infrastructure
            and equipment in five subsectors:  flood control, drainage
            and irrigation; main roads; local roads; primary education;
            and inland water transport.  With that in mind, the project
            comprises (a) rehabilitation of irrigation, drainage and
            flood protection works in all but the southwestern region;
            (b) rehabilitation of roads and associated structures in the
            northwestern and southwestern regions; and (c)
            reconstruction and refurnishing of primary schools.  In
            addition, the project provides for (d) replacement of
            tugboat, navigational aids and water gauging equipment; (e)
            repair of river landing jetties; and (f) provision of
            technical services by local and foreign consultants.
            Without restoration, the efficiency of road and waterway
            systems would be seriously impaired, flood protection and
            irrigation and drainage schemes would be in jeopardy, and
            the primary education of at least 170,000 children would
            suffer.  Consequently, restoration of flood damage is a high priority.
